A Unique Selling Proposition (USP) refers to the unique benefit exhibited by a company, service, product or brand that enables it to stand out from competitors. [[1](https://offeo.com/learn/unique-selling-proposition)]

It is the one thing that makes your business better than the competition. It's a specific and clear benefit that makes your business stand out when compared to other businesses in your market. [[2](https://www.shopify.com/blog/unique-selling-proposition)]

Your USP might speak to a unique quality, feature, or price that differentiates your business from others in the market. [[3](https://www.zendesk.com/blog/unique-selling-proposition/)]

To determine your USP, you should research your competitors and identify their strengths and weaknesses. Then identify the unique benefits of your product or service, and how it addresses the needs of your target market better than your competitors.

For example, if your company is Nero, a skincare brand for men, your USP might be that your products are specifically formulated for men, using natural ingredients from the Amazon rainforest, and are easy to use, delivering results without being time-consuming. This USP differentiates Nero from other skincare brands that may not have specifically formulated products for men, and that may not use natural ingredients.
